com.epoch.mechanisms

Class MechRuleFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.mechanisms.MechRuleFunctions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChemConstants, MechSynthConstants, FormatConstants, MechConstants, MechErrorConstants

    public class MechRuleFunctions
extends Object
implements MechConstants
    Analyzes mechanisms for violations of heuristic rules.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int firstCyclicStageIndex
      Index of the stage (in list of stages) that is the first stage of the cyclic part of a mechanism.
      (package private) Mechanism givenMech
      Student's response mechanism to be analyzed.
      (package private) List<MechStage> stages
      Stages of the student's response mechanism.

      • noSameChargeReacting

        public boolean noSameChargeReacting()
                             throws MechError
        Gets whether an eflow arrow connects two different compounds with the same nonzero charge.
        Returns:
        true if there is no such arrow
        Throws:
        MechError - if there is such an arrow

      • noSameChargeReacting

        public boolean noSameChargeReacting(boolean allowProtonTransfers)
                             throws MechError
        Gets whether an eflow arrow connects two different compounds with the same nonzero charge.
        Parameters:
        allowProtonTransfers - don't consider as a violation a proton transfer (simultaneous gain and loss of H+)
        Returns:
        true if there is no such arrow
        Throws:
        MechError - if there is such an arrow

      • isProtonTransfer

        private boolean isProtonTransfer(List<MechFlow> flows,
                                 MechFlow origFlow,
                                 Molecule srcMol,
                                 MolAtom origSinkH)
        Gets whether two molecules of charge +1 connected by electron-flow arrow and sink of arrow is H is a proton transfer.
        Parameters:
        flows - electron-flow arrows of the stage
        origFlow - electron-flow arrow connecting two like-charged compounds
        srcMol - the source molecule of flow
        origSinkH - the sink atom of flow, already confirmed to be H, that is not in snkMol
        Returns:
        true if this step is merely a proton transfer step

      • containsSN2

        public boolean containsSN2(boolean spOrSp2Matters)
                    throws MechError
        Gets whether there is an SN2 substitution in this compound.
        A.....B-----C (... = incipient bond, --- = single bond)
        AND eflow to A..B AND eflow B--C to C
        MAYBE AND B is sp or sp2-hybridized
        Parameters:
        spOrSp2Matters - whether the SN2 substitution must be at an sp2- or sp-hybridized atom for it to "count"
        Returns:
        true if there is no SN2 substitution
        Throws:
        MechError - if there is an SN2 substitution

      • isMetal

        private boolean isMetal(MolAtom atom)
        Gets whether an atom is a metal.
        Parameters:
        atom - an atom
        Returns:
        true if the atom is a metal

      • isSpOrSp2Hybridized

        private boolean isSpOrSp2Hybridized(MolAtom atom)
        Determines whether an atom is or is not sp- or sp2-hybridized.
        Parameters:
        atom - the atom
        Returns:
        true if the atom is sp- or sp2-hybridized

      • noIonizedBondSpHybridAtom

        public boolean noIonizedBondSpHybridAtom()
                                  throws MechError
        Gets whether ionization occurs at an sp- or sp2-hybridized atom.
        B-----C (--- = single bond)
        AND eflow B--C to C AND no eflow to B
        AND B is sp or sp2 hybridized
        Returns:
        true if there is no such ionization
        Throws:
        MechError - if there is such an ionization

      • addAtomIfBearingLG

        private void addAtomIfBearingLG(MechFlow flow,
                                List<MolAtom> bearLGs)
        Finds if an electron-flow arrow indicates a leaving group leaving an atom. If so, adds the atom bearing the LG to the list.
        Parameters:
        flow - the electron-flow arrow
        bearLGs - list of atoms bearing leaving groups

      • noCarbocations

        public boolean noCarbocations()
                       throws MechError
        Gets whether the compound has a true carbocation other than an iminium ion.
        Returns:
        true if the compound has no true carbocation
        Throws:
        MechError - if the compound has a true carbocation

      • noCarbocations2

        public int[] noCarbocations2()
        Gets whether the compound has a true carbocation.
        Returns:
        array of ints: first member indicates whether a carbocation was found and, if so, its nature; second member indicates the index of the stage in which it was found.

      • isResonantWithLP

        public int isResonantWithLP(MolAtom atom,
                            List<MolAtom> alreadyBeenHere)
        Determines whether an electron-deficient atom has its electron-deficiency mitigated by resonance with an anionic or neutral lone-pair-bearing atom.
        Parameters:
        atom - atom to examine
        alreadyBeenHere - list of MolAtoms that have already been examined; purpose is to prevent an infinite loop upon recursion
        Returns:
        integer describing the kind of resonance found

      • noSupplyReceive

        public boolean noSupplyReceive()
                        throws MechError
        Gets whether an atom both supplies and receives electrons.
        Returns:
        true if the compound has no such atom
        Throws:
        MechError - if the compound has such an atom

      • noSupplyReceive

        private int noSupplyReceive(MechStage stage)
        Gets whether an atom both supplies and receives electrons.
        Parameters:
        stage - stage to examine for the event
        Returns:
        number of electrons in one of the offending electron-flow arrows; NO_VIOLATION for no violation

        Gets whether the mechanism has radicals.
        Returns:
        true if the mechanism has no radicals

        MechError - if the mechanism has radicals

        public boolean noZwitterions(boolean posRequiresH)
                      throws MechError
        Gets whether the mechanism has zwitterions.
        Parameters:
        posRequiresH - counts as a zwitterion only if the positive atom bears an H.
        Returns:
        true if the mechanism has no zwitterions
        Throws:
        MechError - if the mechanism has zwitterions

      • pKaCheck

        public boolean pKaCheck(double pKvalue,
                        boolean acidic)
                 throws PluginException,
                        VerifyException,
                        MechError
        Gets whether any compound has a pKa < or a pKb > a given value.
        Parameters:
        pKvalue - value to compare
        acidic - whether we're comparing pKas or pKbs
        Returns:
        true if the mechanism has no such compound
        Throws:
        MechError - if the mechanism has such compound
        PluginException - if the pK calculation won't proceed
        VerifyException - if a compound can't be analyzed for pK

      • pKaRuleCheck

        public boolean pKaRuleCheck(boolean omitFirstStep,
                            boolean omitLastStep)
                     throws PluginException,
                            VerifyException,
                            MechError
        Gets whether any stage has two atoms with a pKa difference > 8.
        Parameters:
        omitFirstStep - whether to consider the first step
        omitLastStep - whether to consider the last step
        Returns:
        true if the mechanism has no such stage
        Throws:
        MechError - if the mechanism has such compound
        PluginException - if the pK calculation won't proceed
        VerifyException - if a compound can't be analyzed for pK

      • resConnect

        public boolean resConnect(boolean omit1stStep)
                   throws MechError
        Gets whether all "adjacent" stages with resonance structures are connected by resonance arrows.
        Parameters:
        omit1stStep - whether to consider the first step
        Returns:
        true if all resonance structures are connected with resonance arrows
        Throws:
        MechError - if any resonance structures are not connected with resonance arrows

      • connectRes

        public boolean connectRes(boolean omit1stStep)
                   throws MechError
        Gets whether all stages connected by resonance arrows contain resonance structures.
        Parameters:
        omit1stStep - whether to consider the first step
        Returns:
        true if all resonance arrows connect resonance structures
        Throws:
        MechError - if any resonance arrows do not connect resonance structures

                                    MechStage stage2)
        Gets whether two adjacent stages have resonance structures.
        Parameters:
        stage1 - a stage
        stage2 - an adjacent stage
        Returns:
        true if the stages have resonance structures

      • printPeriCode

        public void printPeriCode(int[] rxnData)
        Prints pericyclic reaction data from isPericyclic().
        Parameters:
        rxnData - pericyclic reaction data from isPericyclic()

      • noPeriHasEvenPairsElecs

        public boolean noPeriHasEvenPairsElecs()
                                throws MechError
        Gets whether any pericyclic reactions that are not electrocyclic reactions involve an even number of pairs of electrons in the pericyclic array and, if it is a cycloaddition or retro-cycloaddition, neither component is just one atom.
        Returns:
        true if there are no pericyclic reactions that are not electrocyclic that involve an even number of pairs of electrons
        Throws:
        MechError - if there is such a reaction

      • noPeriInvolvesFourAtoms

        public boolean noPeriInvolvesFourAtoms()
                                throws MechError
        Gets whether any pericyclic reactions other than electrocyclic reactions involve four atoms.
        Returns:
        true if there are no pericyclic reactions that are not electrocyclic that involve four atoms
        Throws:
        MechError - if there is such a reaction

      • isPericyclic

        public List<int[]> isPericyclic()
        Gets descriptions of the pericyclic steps of a mechanism.
        Returns:
        a list of integer arrays, each of which describes a pericyclic step in a mechanism. Each int[] contains the type of pericyclic mechanism, the number of electrons in the pericyclic transition state, the number of atoms in the pericyclic transition state, the size of one component of a sigmatropic rearrangement or cycloaddition, the size of the other component of a sigmatropic rearrangement or cycloaddition, and the index of the stage in which the mechanistic step occurs.

      • isPericyclic

        public int[] isPericyclic(MechStage stage)
                   throws MechError
        Given a stage, gets description of its pericyclic step (if any). Creates a new MechStage by reproducing reactive part of MechStage; see isPericyclicNew() below.
        Parameters:
        stage - stage of a mechanism
        Returns:
        array of int containing the type of pericyclic mechanism, the number of electrons in the pericyclic transition state, the number of atoms in the pericyclic transition state, the size of one component of a sigmatropic rearrangement or cycloaddition, the size of the other component of a sigmatropic rearrangement or cycloaddition, and the index of the stage in which the mechanistic step occurs
        Throws:
        MechError - if a 2-electron arrow points from an atom to one of its ligands

      • createPeriOutput

        public int[] createPeriOutput(Molecule reactArray,
                              List<MolBond> changeSigBonds,
                              int atomsInArray,
                              int eCount,
                              int elecsInSigmaBondBreaks,
                              int elecsInSigmaBondMakes)
        Calculates the type of pericyclic reaction and the return values.
        Parameters:
        reactArray - atoms undergoing a pericyclic reaction
        changeSigBonds - sigma bonds formed or broken in the pericyclic reaction
        atomsInArray - number of atoms involved in the pericyclic reaction
        eCount - number of electrons involved in the pericyclic reaction
        elecsInSigmaBondBreaks - number of electrons in sigma bonds that break in the reaction
        elecsInSigmaBondMakes - number of electrons in sigma bonds that are made in the reaction
        Returns:
        array of ints for isPericyclic() or isPericyclicNew()

      • getComponentSizes

        private List<Integer> getComponentSizes(Molecule reactArray,
                                        List<MolBond> changeSigBonds)
        Gets the number of atoms in each component of a pericyclic reaction.
        Parameters:
        reactArray - atoms undergoing a pericyclic reaction
        changeSigBonds - sigma bonds formed or broken in the pericyclic reaction
        Returns:
        list of component sizes
